benchmark_details.name: VLM-C4L (Vision-Language Model for Continual Core Dataset Learning)
benchmark_details.overview: VLM-C4L introduces a continual learning framework that optimizes corner case datasets for autonomous driving using Vision-Language Models, enabling models to learn from diverse corner cases while preserving performance on previously learned scenarios.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To enhance autonomous driving systems' ability to handle corner cases through a continual learning framework and optimized dataset.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the true positive detections compared to ground truth in the datasets.
methodology.interpretation: Higher AP and AR scores indicate better performance in detecting objects in challenging conditions.
methodology.baseline_results: Sparse R-CNN and Cascade-DETR are used as baseline models.
methodology.validation: The framework is validated through comprehensive experiments on large-scale, real-world datasets.
